list_definition.definition: a type of shoe, made of soft leather, worn by American Indians; an imitation of it

list_ex_of_english: On the industrial side a small start has been made with, surprisingly enough, a cottage industry producing leather moccasin shoes.
Moccasin has also been hit hard by devastating wildfires that struck the area in 1916, 1919, 1922, and 1955.
Loafers are slip-on shoes with a moccasin toe construction and slotted straps stitched across vamps.
Another perishable artifact found was a moccasin, which was worn from use.
It was once the preferred yarn for handsewing the uppers of moccasin-style shoes (loafers), but its use has been replaced by synthetics.
It was named this because its shape resembles a moccasin.
In the winter, the uniforms were supplemented with cold weather gear including capot, moccasins, mittens, and snowshoes.
The name means 'puckered' and probably refers to the seam in their moccasins.
